title.rendered: Five Tips for Maximizing your Matchmaking Success

content.rendered:

column_border_width=”none” column_border_style=”solid” column_padding_type=”advanced” gradient_type=”default”][split_line_heading animation_type=”line-reveal-by-space” font_style=”h2″ line_reveal_by_space_text_effect=”default” content_alignment=”left” mobile_content_alignment=”inherit” link_target=”_self” text_content=”1. Make sure your profile stands out” font_line_height=”1″][/split_line_heading][vc_column_text]Good profiles receive more attention in Matchmaking. Remember to include a profile picture and a company logo, as well as a concise and informative description both for yourself and your business.[/vc_column_text][split_line_heading animation_type=”line-reveal-by-space” font_style=”h2″ line_reveal_by_space_text_effect=”default” content_alignment=”left” mobile_content_alignment=”inherit” link_target=”_self” text_content=”2. Identify the right people to meet” font_line_height=”1″][/split_line_heading][vc_column_text]By selecting simple filters like industry, stage, and geographic focus, you can ensure your requests are going to the right people.[/vc_column_text][split_line_heading animation_type=”line-reveal-by-space” font_style=”h2″ line_reveal_by_space_text_effect=”default” content_alignment=”left” mobile_content_alignment=”inherit” link_target=”_self” text_content=”3. Send a personalized opening message” font_line_height=”1″][/split_line_heading][vc_column_text]Make sure that you explain well why you want to meet the person and why it makes sense for them to take a meeting with you during Slush. Slush week is packed with program and every meeting comes with an opportunity cost.[/vc_column_text][split_line_heading animation_type=”line-reveal-by-space” font_style=”h2″ line_reveal_by_space_text_effect=”default” content_alignment=”left” mobile_content_alignment=”inherit” link_target=”_self” text_content=”4. Keep your inbox clean” font_line_height=”1″][/split_line_heading][vc_column_text]If you get a meeting request and can’t take the meeting, please take the time to decline the meeting request or assign it to someone else in the team.[/vc_column_text][split_line_heading animation_type=”line-reveal-by-space” font_style=”h2″ line_reveal_by_space_text_effect=”default” content_alignment=”left” mobile_content_alignment=”inherit” link_target=”_self” text_content=”5. Choose the right meeting location” font_line_height=”1″][/split_line_heading][vc_column_text]When sending out a meeting request, you need to choose a location for the meeting. Here are the options explained.

  • Meeting Area is a seated area inside the Slush venue specifically reserved for taking meetings. For each meeting in the Meeting Area, there’s a table reserved for the duration of the meeting (25 minutes).
  • 1-on-1 Point is a spot inside the Slush Venue where you can easily find the person you are meeting with. The difference to Meeting Area is that there is no table reservation – it’s there to help you locate the person you are meeting with. Once you have found each other, the actual meeting can take place anywhere.
  • Choose yourself means you can send a meeting request without a specified location – book a time with someone and suggest a spot to meet at the Slush Venue yourself through the chat found in Matchmaking.

In addition, if the person you are meeting with is involved with a company that has an investor lounge or a booth, you can suggest the meeting there.

If you (and the person you’re looking to meet) are attending Investor Day or Founders Day on Day 0 (Nov 29), they appear as locations in the tool.

 

[/vc_column_text][nectar_cta btn_style=”basic” heading_tag=”h4″ button_color=”accent-color” button_color_hover=”#fafafa” text_color=”#101010″ button_border_thickness=”0px” link_type=”new_tab” alignment=”left” alignment_tablet=”default” alignment_phone=”default” constrain_group_3=”yes” constrain_group_4=”yes” display=”block” display_tablet=”inherit” display_phone=”inherit” icon_family=”none” link_text=”START MATCHMAKING HERE” url=”https://platform.slush.org/slush23/matchmaking/browse” padding_top=”10px” padding_bottom=”10px” padding_left=”20px” padding_right=”20px” margin_top=”20px” font_size_desktop=”18px”][vc_column_text]

 

If your or your teammates’ tickets are unassigned, you can’t use the Matchmaking Tool. Quickly assign your tickets before starting to use the tool and you’re all set.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][/vc_column][/vc_row]
